title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: About
text:
Fahim Ahmed is working as a Associate System Performance Engineer with South Carolina Department of Transportation (SCDOT). In his role in the Office of Planning at SCDOT, he prepares and analyzes tranportation data to develop performance metrics and statewide travel demand model to help stakeholders make data-driven decision.
Fahim Ahmed is also a Ph.D. candidate studying Civil Engineering (Dissertation on Transportation Engr.) at University of South Carolina. His research interest is in the topic of freight system performance, vehicle routing, and traffic safety. Currently, he is working with Dr. Nathan Huynh to develop a solution for truck (re-)routing under disruptive environment in a distribution network.

title: Fahim Ahmed
text: Fahim Ahmed is working as a Highway Safety Design Engineer with South Carolina Department of Transportation (SCDOT). In his role in the Traffic Safety Office at SCDOT, he prepares highway designs for safety improvement projects.

title: Ivy Lee method of Gets Things Done
text:
The process of Ivy Lee Method of getting things done is as follows:

At the end of day, write down 6 tasks with priority to do the next day.
Start with first task and keep working on it until finished.
Move to next task if first task is finished.
Repeat the Steps 1-3.


Spill-over of tasks to the following day is allowed.

title: Test Python Code for Quarto
text:
Code
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

r = np.arange(0, 2, 0.01)
theta = 2* np.pi *r 
fig, ax = plt.subplots(subplot_kw={'projection': 'polar'})
ax.plot(theta, r)
ax.set_rticks([0.5, 1, 1.5, 2])
ax.grid(True)
plt.show()
